channel.title: Bloomberg On the Economy
channel.itunes:subtitle: Michael McKee and Carol Massar tap the best minds in economics.
channel.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
channel.itunes:summary: Michael McKee and Carol Massar tap the best minds in economics.
channel.description: Michael McKee and Carol Massar tap the best minds in economics.

item.title: NYU's Spence Says Progress in Spain Critical for Europe (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: NYU's Spence Says Progress in Spain Critical
item.itunes:summary:
June 6 (Bloomberg) -- Michael Spence, professor of economics at New York University's Stern School of Business and author of "The Last Convergence," says progress in Spain is absolutely critical to solving the euro crisis. Spence speaks with Bloomberg's Scarlet Fu and Josh Lipton on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Rosner, Tchir, Whalen Discuss Financials, Bank Stocks (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Rosner, Tchir, Whalen Discuss Financials
item.itunes:summary:
June 5 (Bloomberg) -- Peter Tchir, founder of TF Market Advisors, Chris Whalen, senior managing director at Tangent Capital Partners LLC, and Josh Rosner, managing director and bank analyst at Graham Fisher & Co. discuss financial stocks and the current regulatory environment. They speak with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Michael Casey Discusses Book `The Unfair Trade' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Michael Casey Discusses Book `The Unfair Trade'
item.itunes:summary:
June 1 (Bloomberg) -- Author Michael Casey discusses his new book, "The Unfair Trade: How Our Broken Global Financial System Destroys the Middle Class." Casey speaks with Bloomberg's Scarlet Fu and Josh Lipton on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tchir, Whalen, Childs Discuss Financial Stocks (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Tchir, Whalen, Childs Discuss Financial Stocks
item.itunes:summary:
May 31 (Bloomberg) -- Peter Tchir, founder of TF Market Advisors, Chris Whalen, senior managing director at Tangent Capital Partners LLC, and Bloomberg reporter Mary Childs discuss financial stocks and the current regulatory environment. Whalen, Tchir and Childs speak to Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Kotok Discusses Book `From Bear to Bulls With ETFs' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Kotok Discusses Book `From Bear to Bulls With ETFs'
item.itunes:summary:
May 30 (Bloomberg) -- David Kotok, chairman and chief investment officer of Cumberland Advisors, discusses his new book "From Bear to Bulls with ETFs." Kotok speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Investor Mark Mobius Discusses Europe, U.S., China (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Investor Mark Mobius Discusses Europe, U.S., China
item.itunes:summary:
May 30 (Bloomberg) -- Mark Mobius, chairman of Templeton Emerging Markets, says China is likely to grow at a rate of 8 percent. He also doesn't expect Europe and the U.S. to fall into recession. Mobius speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Signet's Angus Blair Discusses Egyptian Elections (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Signet's Angus Blair Discusses Egyptian Elections
item.itunes:summary:
May 29 (Bloomberg) -- Angus Blair, chairman of Cairo-based Signet Institute, says that the next Egyptian president and parliament will have to work together to help address the country's economic problems. Blair speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Skidelsky Discusses Keynesian Solution to Euro Crisis (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Skidelsky Discusses Keynesian Solution Euro Crisis
item.itunes:summary:
May 24 (Bloomberg) -- Lord Robert Skidelsky, member of the U.K. House of Lords and emeritus professor of political science at the University of Warwick, discusses what he believes John Maynard Keynes would do to solve the euro crisis. Lord Skidelsky speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Metzl Discusses Prospects for Economic Reform in China (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Metzl Discusses Economic Reform in China
item.itunes:summary:
May 24 (Bloomberg) -- Jamie Metzl, senior fellow at the Asia Society and co-chairman of Partnership for a Secure America, discusses the slowing Chinese economy and prospects for economic reform in China. Metzl speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Schiff Discusses Book `America's Coming Bankruptcy' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Schiff Discusses Book `America's Coming Bankruptcy'
item.itunes:summary:
May 22 (Bloomberg) -- Peter Schiff, author of "America's Coming Bankruptcy: The Real Crash: How to Save Yourself and Your Company" discusses the book. Schiff speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BofAML's Michelle Meyer Discusses U.S. Housing, Jobs (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: BofAML's Michelle Meyer Discusses U.S. Housing, Job
item.itunes:summary:
May 22 (Bloomberg) -- Michelle Meyer, senior U.S. economist at Merrill Lynch, discusses the outlook for housing and employment in the U.S. Meyer speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Kotok Says Italy is the `Real Monster to Worry About' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Kotok Says Italy is the Real Monster to Worry About
item.itunes:summary:
May 21 (Bloomberg) -- David Kotok, chairman and chief investment officer of Cumberland Advisors, says Italy has a "too big to fail" economy with the third largest debt in the world. Kotok speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Berkeley's Eichengreen Discusses Chinese Economy (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Berkeley's Eichengreen Discusses Chinese Economy
item.itunes:summary:
May 21 (Bloomberg) -- Barry Eichengreen, professor of economics at University of California Berkeley, says he is beginning to see Chinese companies diversify their portfolios, leading to a soft landing for China's economy in 2012. Eichengreen speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SocGen's Hill Discusses Spain, Greek Exit From Euro (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: SocGen's Hill Discusses Spain, Greek Exit From Euro
item.itunes:summary:
May 18 (Bloomberg) -- Jeremy Hill, chief operating officer of the U.S. research department at Societe General, discusses contagion in Spain, and the possibility of a Greek exit from the euro. Hill speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Dartmouth's Papaioannou Says Greek Euro Exit Dangerous (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Papaioannou Says Greek Euro Exit Dangerous
item.itunes:summary:
May 17 (Bloomberg) -- Elias Papaioannou, professor of economics at Dartmouth College says a Greek exit from the euro would have terrible implications for its economy and the rest of the euro zone. Papaioannou speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Juckes Says `Crisis Is Catalyst for Crisis' in Europe (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Juckes Says `Crisis Is Catalyst for Crisis' in Euro
item.itunes:summary:
May 17 (Bloomberg) -- Kit Juckes, head of FX research at Soc Generale, says he is becoming more pessimistic about the state of the euro and European leadership. Juckes speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Economist Williams Discusses China's Property Bubble (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Williams Discusses China's Property Bubble
item.itunes:summary:
May 15 (Bloomberg) -- Mark Williams, Asia economist at Capital Economics Ltd., says "property in China is not looking good at the moment," and monetary policy is moving in the wrong direction. Williams speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: GreyLock's Humes Says Greeks Wants to Stay in EU (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: GreyLock's Humes Says Greeks Wants to Stay in EU
item.itunes:summary:
May 15 (Bloomberg) -- Hans Humes, president and chief investment officer of Greylock Capital Management, says that polls suggest that Greeks want to stay in the European Union. Humes speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tuft's Ioannides Says More Greek Elections Likely (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Tuft's Ioannides Says More Greek Elections Likely
item.itunes:summary:
May 15 (Bloomberg) -- Yannis Ioannides, professor of economics at Tufts University, says there is no easy way out of financial problems for Greece, and more elections are likely. Ioannides speaks with Bloomberg's Carol Massar and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: UBS's Deo Discusses Future for Greece, France, EU (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: UBS's Deo Discusses Future for Greece, France, EU
item.itunes:summary:
May 10 (Bloomberg) -- Stephane Deo, chief European economist at UBS Securities LLC, discusses the aftermath of the Greek and French elections. Deo speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tufts's Ioannides, EF's Xafa Discuss Greek Elections (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Tufts's Ioannides, EF's Xafa Discuss Greek Election
item.itunes:summary:
May 10 (Bloomberg) -- Yannis Ioannides, professor of economics at Tufts University and Miranda Xafa, president of EF Consulting in Athens, say they are saddened by the Greek elections of May 6, and hope that there will be a second round. Ioannides and Xafa speak with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Roubini's Greene Says High Chance Greece Exits Euro (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Roubini's Greene Says High Chance Greece Exits Euro
item.itunes:summary:
May 10 (Bloomberg) -- Megan Greene, senior economist at Roubini Global Economics LLC, says that while a Greek exit from the euro zone is being openly discussed, if it happens in an un-orderly fashion it will lead to contagion in Italy and Spain. Greene speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Rhodes Says Greece `in Depression,' Not Recession (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Rhodes Says Greece `in Depression,' Not Recession
item.itunes:summary:
May 8 (Bloomberg) -- Bill Rhodes, president and chief executive officer of William R. Rhodes Global Advisors, says "Greece is in a depression." Rhode's speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Varoufarkis Sees Second Vote, New Government in Greece (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Varoufarkis Sees Second Vote, New Greek Gov't
item.itunes:summary:
May 8 (Bloomberg) -- Yanis Varoufakis, professor of economics at the University of Athens, says a second Greek vote may lead to a new government. Varoufarkis speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Lutetia's Seiman Says Greece Should Have Left Euro (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Lutetia's Seiman Says Greece Should Have Left Euro
item.itunes:summary:
May 8 (Bloomberg) -- Fabrice Seiman, co-chief executive officer of Lutetia Capital in Paris, discusses the French reaction to austerity measures and bailouts in euro-zone countries. Seiman speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Broad Discusses Book `The Art of Being Unreasonable' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Broad Discusses Book `The Art of Being Unreasonable
item.itunes:summary:
May 7 (Bloomberg) -- Eli Broad, founder of KB Homes and SunAmerica, discusses his new book, "The Art of Being Unreasonable: Lessons in Unconventional Thinking." Broad speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy." Bloomberg's Carol Massar joins in the interview.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: NYU's Economides Discusses Sunday's Greek Elections (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: NYU's Economides Discusses Sunday's Greek Elections
item.itunes:summary:
May 7 (Bloomberg) -- Nicholas Economides, professor of economics at New York University's Stern School of Business, discusses the Greek elections that took place on Sunday. Economides speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CME's Putnam Discusses Fed, Quantitative Easing, ECB (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: CME's Putnam Discusses Fed, QE, ECB
item.itunes:summary:
May 4 (Bloomberg) -- Bluford Putnam, chief economist at the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, discusses issues that the Federal Reserve will face while exiting quantitative easing. Putnam speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Economist Ian Shepherdson Previews April Jobs Report (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Ian Shepherdson Previews April Jobs Report
item.itunes:summary:
May 3 (Bloomberg) -- Ian Shepherdson, chief U.S. economist at High Frequency Economics, previews the April employment report. Shepherdson speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Economist Varoufakis Previews Greek Elections (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Economist Varoufakis Previews Greek Elections
item.itunes:summary:
May 3 (Bloomberg) -- Yanis Varoufakis, professor of economics at the University of Athens, discusses the Greek economy and previews Greece's Sunday elections. Varoufakis speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: May 3, 2012 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: May 3
item.itunes:summary:
May 3 (Bloomberg) -- Betty Liu hosts Bloomberg Radio's "In the Loop, At the Half," featuring a recap of market action since the opening bell, a "drill down" into a top story of the day, a "trader radar" interview examining the thoughts of a trader on one of the trading floors, and a "four to go" segment on the four things listeners should know for the afternoon's trading.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Ambassador Vale De Almeida Discusses EU, Euro Zone (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Ambassador Vale De Almeida Discusses EU, Euro Zone
item.itunes:summary:
May 2 (Bloomberg) -- Joao Vale De Almeida, European Union ambassador to the U.S., discusses finding the right mix of austerity and growth to solve Europe's economic problems. Almeida speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: May 2, 2012 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: May 2
item.itunes:summary:
May 2 (Bloomberg) -- Betty Liu hosts Bloomberg Radio's "In the Loop, At the Half," featuring a recap of market action since the opening bell, a "drill down" into a top story of the day, a "trader radar" interview examining the thoughts of a trader on one of the trading floors, and a "four to go" segment on the four things listeners should know for the afternoon's trading.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Chris Rupkey Discusses Fed, ISM April Factory Index (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Chris Rupkey Discusses Fed, ISM April Factory Index
item.itunes:summary:
May 1 (Bloomberg) -- Chris Rupkey, chief financial economist at Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi discusses the Federal Reserve and the Institute for Supply Management's April factory index. Rupkey speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: May 1, 2012 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: May 1
item.itunes:summary:
May 1 (Bloomberg) -- Betty Liu hosts Bloomberg Radio's "In the Loop, At the Half," featuring a recap of market action since the opening bell, a "drill down" into a top story of the day, a "trader radar" interview examining the thoughts of a trader on one of the trading floors, and a "four to go" segment on the four things listeners should know for the afternoon's trading.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Karen Petrou Discusses 'Too Big to Fail' Banks, Fed (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Karen Petrou Discusses 'Too Big to Fail' Banks, Fed
item.itunes:summary:
April 30 (Bloomberg) -- Karen Shaw Petrou, managing partner and co-founder of Federal Financial Analytics, discusses how the largest U.S. banks are resisting the Federal Reserve's credit risk limits. Petrou speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: April 30, 2012 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: April 30
item.itunes:summary:
April 30 (Bloomberg) -- Betty Liu hosts Bloomberg Radio's "In the Loop, At the Half," featuring a recap of market action since the opening bell, a "drill down" into a top story of the day, a "trader radar" interview examining the thoughts of a trader on one of the trading floors, and a "four to go" segment on the four things listeners should know for the afternoon's trading.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: TF Market's Tchir Discusses Austerity in Euro Zone (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: TF Market's Tchir Discusses Austerity in Euro Zone
item.itunes:summary:
April 27 (Bloomberg) -- Peter Tchir, founder of TF Market Advisors, discusses austerity in the euro zone. Tchir speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Mexico's Gloria Guevara Discusses Economy, Tourism (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Mexico's Gloria Guevara Discusses Economy, Tourism
item.itunes:summary:
April 27 (Bloomberg) -- Gloria Guevara, Secretary of Tourism for Mexico, discusses the interplay between tourism and the Mexican economy. Secretary Guevara speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: April 27, 2012 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: April 27
item.itunes:summary:
April 27 (Bloomberg) -- Betty Liu hosts Bloomberg Radio's "In the Loop, At the Half," featuring a recap of market action since the opening bell, a "drill down" into a top story of the day, a "trader radar" interview examining the thoughts of a trader on one of the trading floors, and a "four to go" segment on the four things listeners should know for the afternoon's trading.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Weeden's Maxwell Discusses Outlook on Oil, Economy (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Weeden's Maxwell Discusses Outlook on Oil, Economy
item.itunes:summary:
April 27 (Bloomberg) -- Charles Maxwell, senior energy analyst at Weeden & Co. LP and chairman of American DG Energy Inc., discusses gasoline, diesel fuel and their effects on the global economy. Maxwell speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Alpert, Matus Debate Future of U.S. Economy (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Alpert, Matus Debate Future of U.S. Economy
item.itunes:summary:
April 26 (Bloomberg) -- Daniel Alpert, managing director of Westwood Capital LLC, and Drew Matus, senior U.S. economist at UBS Securities, debate whether another round of quantitative easing is necessary. Matus and Alpert speak with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: April 26, 2012 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: April 26
item.itunes:summary:
April 26 (Bloomberg) -- Betty Liu hosts Bloomberg Radio's "In the Loop, At the Half," featuring a recap of market action since the opening bell, a "drill down" into a top story of the day, a "trader radar" interview examining the thoughts of a trader on one of the trading floors, and a "four to go" segment on the four things listeners should know for the afternoon's trading.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Harvard's Sandel Discusses Book, 'What Money Can't Buy' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Harvard's Sandel Discusses Book
item.itunes:summary:
April 25 (Bloomberg) -- Michael Sandel, professor of government at Harvard University, discusses his new book, "What Money Can't Buy: The Moral Limits of Markets." Sandel speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: UniCredit's Bandholz Discusses FOMC, QE3, Economy (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: UniCredit's Bandholz Discusses FOMC, QE3, Economy
item.itunes:summary:
April 25 (Bloomberg) -- Dr. Harm Bandholz, chief U.S. economist at UniCredit Group, discusses the Federal Reserve, quantitative easing and the U.S economy. Bandholz speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: April 25, 2012 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: April 25
item.itunes:summary:
April 25 (Bloomberg) -- Betty Liu hosts Bloomberg Radio's "In the Loop, At the Half," featuring a recap of market action since the opening bell, a "drill down" into a top story of the day, a "trader radar" interview examining the thoughts of a trader on one of the trading floors, and a "four to go" segment on the four things listeners should know for the afternoon's trading.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Economist Weinberg on IMF, Risks for Global Inflation (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Weinberg on IMF, Risks for Global Inflation
item.itunes:summary:
April 24 (Bloomberg) -- Carl Weinberg, chief economist and founder of High Frequency Economics, says if the International Monetary Fund effectively prints new money, we are at risk for global inflation. Weinberg speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BNP's Barbet Discusses French Elections, Budget (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: BNP's Barbet Discusses French Elections, Budget
item.itunes:summary:
April 24 (Bloomberg) -- Dominique Barbet, senior economist at BNP Paribas SA in Paris, discusses the second round of polling in the French elections and the French budget. Barbet speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: April 23, 2012 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Loop, At the Half With Betty Liu: April 23
item.itunes:summary:
April 24 (Bloomberg) -- Betty Liu hosts Bloomberg Radio's "In the Loop, At the Half," featuring a recap of market action since the opening bell, a "drill down" into a top story of the day, a "trader radar" interview examining the thoughts of a trader on one of the trading floors, and a "four to go" segment on the four things listeners should know for the afternoon's trading.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Graham Fisher's Rosner Discusses Argentina, Greece (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Graham Fisher's Rosner Discusses Argentina, Greece
item.itunes:summary:
April 23 (Bloomberg) -- Joshua Rosner, managing director and bank analyst at Graham Fisher & Co., discusses his paper, "The Argentine Model, Part II: Avoiding Crisis and Securing the Future," in relation to the Greek fiscal crisis. Rosner speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: In the Loop With Betty Liu: April 23, 2012 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Loop With Betty Liu: April 23, 2012
item.itunes:summary:
April 23 (Bloomberg) -- Betty Liu hosts Bloomberg Radio's "In the Loop," featuring a recap of market action since the opening bell, a "drill down" into a top story of the day, a "trader radar" interview examining the thoughts of a trader on one of the trading floors, and a "four to go" segment on the four things listeners should know for the afternoon's trading.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BofAML's Dutta Says Data Is 'Down on the U.S. Economy' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: BofAML's Dutta Says Data Is 'Down on U.S. Economy'
item.itunes:summary:
April 20 (Bloomberg) -- Neil Dutta, senior U.S. economist at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, says economic data points to a slowing in momentum" for the U.S. economy. Dutta speaks with Bloomberg's Michael McKee and Scarlett Fu on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Conference Board's Bostjancic Discusses March LEI (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Conference Board's Bostjancic Discusses March LEI
item.itunes:summary:
April 19 (Bloomberg) -- Kathleen Bostjancic, director of macro analysis at the Conference Board, discusses the Conference Board's index of U.S. leading economic indicators for March. Bostjancic speaks with Bloomberg's Michael McKee and Scarlett Fu on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stanford's Admati Discusses Banking Reform (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Stanford's Admati Discusses Banking Reform
item.itunes:summary:
April 17 (Bloomberg) -- Anat Admati, professor of finance and economics at Stanford Graduate School of Business, discusses the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, the Volcker Rule and banking reform. Admati speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Convergex's Colas on Major League Baseball, Economy (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Convergex's Colas on Major League Baseball, Economy
item.itunes:summary:
April 16 (Bloomberg) -- Nicholas Colas, chief market strategist at Convergex Group, discusses the relationship between Major League Baseball and the economy. Colas speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BMO's Gregory Discusses Initial Jobless Claims (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: BMO's Gregory Discusses Initial Jobless Claims
item.itunes:summary:
April 13 (Bloomberg) -- Michael Gregory, managing director and senior economist at BMO Capital Markets, discusses the trade balance and initial jobless claims. Gregory speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Faros's Borthwick Says Euro Is "Safest' Currency (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Faros's Borthwick Says Euro Is "Safest' Currency
item.itunes:summary:
April 13 (Bloomberg) -- Douglas Borthwick, managing director and head of foreign exchange trading at Faros Trading LLC, says the euro is the safest currency to invest in right now. Borthwick speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bob Auer Discusses Caterpillar, Financial Equities (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Bob Auer Discusses Caterpillar, Financial Equities
item.itunes:summary:
April 13 (Bloomberg) -- Bob Auer, senior portfolio manager at SB Auer Funds LLC, says he is bullish on equities. He discusses financial stocks and Caterpiller Inc. Auer speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy." Erik Schatzker joins the conversation.
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Sharma Discusses New Book, 'Breakout Nations' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Sharma Discusses New Book, 'Breakout Nations'
item.itunes:summary:
April 11 (Bloomberg) -- Ruchir Sharma, managing director and portfolio manager at Morgan Stanley discusses his new book, "Breakout Nations: In Pursuit of the Next Economic Mircacles." Sharma speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: MIT's Johnson Discusses New Book, 'White House Burning' (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: MIT's Johnson Discusses Book, 'White House Burning'
item.itunes:summary:
April 11 (Bloomberg) -- Simon Johnson, professor of finance at MIT's Sloan School of Management, discusses his new book, "White House Burning." Johnson speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Brown Brothers Harriman's Chandler Discusses Currencies (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Chandler Discusses Currenencies
item.itunes:summary:
April 9 (Bloomberg) -- Marc Chandler, chief currency strategist at Brown Brothers Harriman & Co., says his favorite currency pair is the Australian dollar against the Japanese yen. Chandler Speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Moodys's Zandi Reacts to Jobs Report, Discusses QE3 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Moodys's Zandi Reacts to Jobs Report, Discusses QE3
item.itunes:summary: April 9 (Bloomberg) -- Mark Zandi, chief economist at Moodys Analytics, says good weather affected the March employment report. He says if the economy weakens, the Federal Reserve will launch another round of quantitative easing, but he does not forsee this happening. Zandi speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BofAML's Meyer Discusses Retail Sales, Jobless Claims (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Meyer Discusses Retail Sales, Jobless Claims
item.itunes:summary:
April 5 (Bloomberg) -- Michelle Meyer, senior U.S. economist at Merrill Lynch, discusses retail sales and jobless claims, and previews Friday's housing report. Meyer's speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SB Auer Funds's Bob Auer Bullish on Equities (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: SB Auer Funds's Bob Auer Bullish on Equities
item.itunes:summary:
April 4 (Bloomberg) -- Bob Auer, senior portfolio manager at SB Auer Funds LLC, says the sovereign debt crisis will eventually "boomerang investors back to stocks." Auer speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: FX Concepts's Taylor Discusses QE3, Euro Zone (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: FX Concepts's Taylor Discusses QE3, Euro Zone
item.itunes:summary:
April 2 (Bloomberg) -- John Taylor, founder of the currency hedge fund FX Concepts LLC, says a third round of quantitative easing is coming. Taylor also discusses changes in the euro zone with Megan Greene, senior economist at Roubini Global Economics LLC. Taylor and Greene speak with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Signet's Blair Discusses Middle East, North Africa (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Signet's Blair Discusses Middle East, North Africa
item.itunes:summary:
April 02 (Bloomberg) -- Angus Blair, chairman of Cairo-based Signet Institute, discusses political uprisings in the Middle East and North Africa. Blair speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Pierpont's Stanley Discusses Housing, Jobs (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Pierpont's Stanley Discusses Housing, Jobs
item.itunes:summary:
March 27 (Bloomberg) -- Stephen Stanley, chief economist at Pierpont Securities LLC, says even though consumer confidence dropped in March, Americans are more optimistic about housing. Stanley speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Pension Partners's Gayed Discusses Fed and QE3 Debate (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Pension's Gayed Discusses Fed and QE3 Debate
item.itunes:summary:
March 27 (Bloomberg) -- Michael Gayed, chief investment strategist at Pension Partners LLC, says a third round of quantitative easing would not help the U.S. economy. Gayed Speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Faros's Borthwick Discusses Interest Rates and QE3 (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Faros's Borthwick Discusses Interest Rates and QE3
item.itunes:summary:
March 23 (Bloomberg) -- Douglas Borthwick, managing director and head of foreign exchange trading at Faros Trading LLC, says a third round of quantitative easing is dependent upon where the dollar shifts. Borthwick speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: JPMorgan's Kasman Says Global Economy Strengthening
item.itunes:summary:
March 23 (Bloomberg) -- Bruce Kasman, chief economist at JPMorgan Chase & Co. in New York, says the global economy is gaining momentum and will continue strengthening into the beginning of the second half of 2012. Kasman speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:subtitle: Bostjancic Discusses February LEI
item.itunes:summary:
March 22 (Bloomberg) -- Kathleen Bostjancic, director of macro analysis at the Conference Board, discusses the Conference Board's index of U.S. leading economic indicators for February. Bostjancic speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Nomura's Zentner Discusses U.S. Home Sales
item.itunes:summary:
March 21 (Bloomberg) -- Ellen Zentner, executive director and senior U.S. economist at Nomura Securities, discusses U.S. existing home sales and jobs. Zentner speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Weeden's Maxwell Discusses Global Gasoline Prices
item.itunes:summary:
March 21 (Bloomberg) -- Charles Maxwell, senior energy analyst at Weeden & Co. LP discusses the rise in gasoline prices around the world. Maxwell speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Milano Discusses Cash Deployment Strategies
item.itunes:summary:
March 20 (Bloomberg) -- Gregory Milano, chief executive officer and co-founder of Fortuna Advisors, discusses the best ways for companies to deploy cash. Milano speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Conference Board Study Shows Disparity Among CEOs
item.itunes:summary:
March 20 (Bloomberg) -- Jon Spector, chief executive officer of the Conference Board, discusses its new study which reveals differences in strategy and challenges among chief executives in emerging and mature economies. Spector speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News

item.itunes:summary:
March 20 (Bloomberg) -- James Galbraith, professor of economics at the University of Texas in Austin, discusses his new book, "Inequality and Instability: A Study of The World Economy Just Before the Great Crisis." Galbraith speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Author Meltzer Discusses New Book, 'Why Capitalism?
item.itunes:summary:
March 16 (Bloomberg) -- Dr. Allan H. Meltzer, professor of political economy at Carnegie Mellon, discusses his book, "Why Capitalism?" Meltzer speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Minto Discusses Business Side of NCAA Basketball
item.itunes:summary:
March 12 (Bloomberg) -- Scott Minto, director of the sports business management program at San Diego State University, discusses the business side of the National Collegiate Athletic Association. Minto talks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: MKM's Darda Says Bond Yields Will Not Reach 2011 Highs (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Darda Says Bond Yields Will Not Reach 2011 Highs
item.itunes:summary:
March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Michael Darda, chief economist and chief market strategist at MKM Partners LP, says rising bond yields will not reach 2011 highs. Darda speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BofA's Dutta Says Good Weather Helped U.S. Job Growth (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: BofA's Dutta Says Weather Helped U.S. Job Growth
item.itunes:summary:
March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Neil Dutta, senior U.S. economist at Bank of America Merrill Lynch says the positive February jobs report is partially the result of warm weather. Dutta speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Sri-Kumar Dubious About Continued U.S. Job Growth (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Sri-Kumar Dubious About Continued U.S. Job Growth
item.itunes:summary:
March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Komal Sri-Kumar, managing director of Trust Company of the West, says despite three months of strong U.S. job growth, reduced gross domestic product estimates for the first quarter of 2012 are putting downward pressure on new jobs. Sri-Kumar speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Cinga's Cordani Discusses Future of Health Care (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Cinga's Cordani Discusses Future of Health Care
item.itunes:summary:
March 14 (Bloomberg) -- David Cordani, chief executive officer of health-insurer Cinga Corp., discusses sustainable health care development for the future, and Supreme Court consideration of the constitutionality of President Obama's health care reform law. Cordani speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Levine and Barth Discuss "Guardians of Finance" Book (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Levine and Barth Discuss "Guardians of Finance"
item.itunes:summary:
March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Ross Levine, professor of economics at Brown University and James Barth, senior finance fellow at the Milken Institute, discuss their new book, "Guardians of Finance: Making Regulators Work for Us." Levine and Barth speak with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: U.S. to Win Most Olympic Gold, Economic Model Predicts (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: U.S. to Win Olympic Gold, Economic Model Predicts
item.itunes:summary:
March 13 (Bloomberg) -- Daniel Johnson, a professor of economics at Colorado College, says an economic model predicts that U.S. athletes will win the most gold medals at this year's Olympic Games in London. Johnson speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: IShares's Koesterich Discusses Seeking Yields Abroad (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Koesterich Discusses Seeking Yields Abroad
item.itunes:summary: March 13 (Bloomberg) -- Russ Koesterich, global chief investment strategist at BlackRock Inc.'s iShares, discusses his theory on looking for dividends outside the U.S. and where to invest abroad. Koesterich speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Erik Nielsen Discusses Debt Restructuring in Europe (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Erik Nielsen Discusses Debt Restructuring in Europe
item.itunes:summary:
March 12 (Bloomberg) -- Erik Nielsen, global chief economist at Unicredit Bank AG, says the implementation of a deal to write down Greek debt does not mean austerity in peripheral countries will be avoided. Nielsen speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Mesirow's Swonk Sees Improving U.S. Economy (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Mesirow's Swonk Sees Improving U.S. Economy
item.itunes:summary:
March 12 (Bloomberg) -- Diane Swonk, chief economist at Mesirow Financial discusses this week's Federal Reserve meeting and Friday's positive jobs report. Swonk speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: James Hamilton Discusses Rising Oil Prices, Fed
item.itunes:summary:
March 12 (Bloomberg) -- James Hamilton, professor of economics at University of California, discusses rising oil prices and this week's Federal Reserve meeting. Hamilton speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: S&P Capital IQ's Young on Investment Outlooks, Earnings (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: S&P Capital IQ's Young on Investment Outlooks
item.itunes:summary:
March 12 (Bloomberg) -- Alec Young, global equity strategist at S&P Capital IQ, discusses U.S. and international investment outlooks and previews first quarter earnings. Young speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: UBS's Matus Says Positive Job Trend Accelerating (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: UBS's Matus Says Positive Job Trend Accelerating
item.itunes:summary:
March 9 (Bloomberg) -- Drew Matus, managing director and senior U.S. economist at UBS Securities LLC, says that a positive trend in U.S. employment appears to be accelerating. Matus speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Greylock's Humes Says Greek Debt Swap Is Secure (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Greylock's Humes Says Greek Debt Swap Is Secure
item.itunes:summary:
March 9 (Bloomberg) -- Hans Humes, president and chief investment officer of Greylock Capital Management, discusses Greek debt swap negotiations. Humes speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Schmieding Says Greece Must Shift From Fiscal Austerity (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Schmieding: Greece Must Shift From Fiscal Austerity
item.itunes:summary:
March 8 (Bloomberg) -- Holger Schmieding, chief economist at Berenberg Bank, says Greece must shift away from fiscal austerity and have a simple tax system. Schmieding speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SocGen's Juckes Says BOJ Must Fight Inflation (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: SocGen's Juckes Says BOJ Must Fight Inflation
item.itunes:summary:
March 8 (Bloomberg) -- Kit Juckes, head of foreign exchange research at Societe Generale SA, says the Bank of Japan must fight inflation more aggressively. Juckes speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Kimball Says ECB Dependency on Liquidity Prevalent (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Kimball Says ECB Dependency on Liquidity Prevalent
item.itunes:summary:
March 8 (Bloomberg) -- Scott Kimball, co-portfolio manager at Taplin Canida & Habacht, says the European Central Bank long-term refinancing operation (LTRO) suggests that dependency on liquidity provisions has not diminished and there is lack of clarity regarding actual measures to reduce debt dependency going forward. Kimball speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Win Thin Says Markets Too Optimistic About Euro Zone (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Thin Says Markets Too Optimistic About Euro Zone
item.itunes:summary:
March 7 (Bloomberg) -- Win Thin, the global head of emerging markets strategy at Brown Brothers Harriman & Co. talks about BRIC nations and the global growth behind emerging markets. He says "there is room for fiscal stimulus but not as much as in past years." Thin speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Pierpont's Stanley Sees Delayed Recovery for U.S. (Audio)
item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Pierpont's Stanley Sees Delayed Recovery for U.S.
item.itunes:summary:
March 7 (Bloomberg) -- Stephen Stanley, chief economist at Pierpont Securities, says while the economy is getting better, it is on a slow road to recovery. Stanley speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: TH Capital's Hou Discusses China's Economy, Markets
item.itunes:summary:
March 7 (Bloomberg) -- Tian Hou, an analyst and founder of TH Capital LLC in Beijing, discusses China's economy. Hou speaks with Bloomberg's Sara Eisen and Michael McKee on "Bloomberg On the Economy."
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:subtitle: Principal Global's Sansoterra Discusses Apple

(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Schork Says Gasoline will Rise to Over $4 a Gallon
item.itunes:summary:

(Source: Bloomberg)

item.itunes:author: Bloomberg News
item.itunes:subtitle: Sentinel's Thwaites Says 'Trend Is Up' for Equities
item.itunes:summary:
